text: Anna Maree Dodd (née Corbin; born 24 October 1980) is a former New Zealand international cricketer who represented the New Zealand national team between 2002 and 2006. She played as a right-arm off-spin bowler. Dodd was born in Foxton, in New Zealand's Manawatū-Whanganui region.New Zealand / Players / Anna Dodd, ESPNcricinfo. Retrieved 23 August 2016. After several years playing with the Wellington Blaze domestically, she was selected in the New Zealand squad for a tour of India in November and December 2001.Lynn McConnell, "Four new caps for world champions' tour to India", ESPNcricinfo, 2 October 2001. Retrieved 23 August 2016. That tour was cancelled,Lynn McConnell, "Corbin and Penn take Wellington's top awards", ESPNcricinfo, 16 April 2002. Retrieved 23 August 2016. but Dodd eventually made her international debut in a One Day International (ODI) against Australia in February 2002.Women's ODI matches played by Anna Dodd, CricketArchive. Retrieved 23 August 2016. When New Zealand toured Europe later in the year, she took what would be career-best figures against the Netherlands, finishing with 3/13 from five overs.Netherlands Women v New Zealand Women, New Zealand Women in Ireland and Netherlands 2002 (2nd ODI), CricketArchive. Retrieved 23 August 2016. At the 2005 World Cup in South Africa, Dodd played in five of her team's seven matches, taking three wickets with a best of 2/15 against Sri Lanka.Women's World Cup, 2004/05 - New Zealand Women / Records / Batting and bowling averages, ESPNcricinfo. Retrieved 23 August 2016. Her last international matches came in October 2006, in an ODI series against Australia. She played in 31 ODIs in total, taking 28 wickets. ==References== ==External links== * Anne Dodd at CricketArchive * Anna Dodd at ESPNcricinfo Category:1980 births Category:Living people Category:New Zealand women cricketers Category:New Zealand women One Day International cricketers Category:People from Foxton, New Zealand Category:Wellington Blaze cricketers
title: Anna Dodd
